捨.definition: to give up; to abandon; to give alms

捨不得.definition: to hate to do sth; to hate to part with; to begrudge

捨不得孩子套不住狼.pinyin: she3 bu4 de5 hai2 zi5 tao4 bu4 zhu4 lang2
捨不得孩子套不住狼.definition: one who is not prepared to risk his child will never catch the wolf (proverb); (fig.) one who is unwilling to take risks will not achieve great things

捨己.definition: selfless; self-sacrifice (to help others); self-renunciation; altruism

捨己救人.definition: to abandon self for others (idiom); to sacrifice oneself to help the people; altruism

捨己為人.definition: to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people; altruism

捨己為公.definition: to give up one's private interests for the public good (idiom); to behave altruistically; selfless and public spirited

捨得.definition: to be willing to part with sth

捨得一身剮，敢把皇帝拉下馬.pinyin: she3 de5 yi1 shen1 gua3 , gan3 ba3 huang2 di4 la1 xia4 ma3
捨得一身剮，敢把皇帝拉下馬.definition: one who does not fear the death of thousand cuts will dare to unhorse the emperor (proverb); to a fearless person, no fence is high enough

捨本逐末.definition: to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom); to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details

捨棄.definition: to give up; to abandon; to abort

捨正從邪.definition: to be corrupted by evil influences (idiom)

捨生取義.definition: to give up life for righteousness (idiom, from Mencius); to choose honor over life; would rather sacrifice one's life than one's principles

捨生忘死.definition: bravery with no thought of personal safety (idiom); risking life and limb; undaunted by perils

捨身求法.definition: to abandon one's body in the search for Buddha's truth (idiom)

捨車保帥.definition: rook sacrifice to save the king (in Chinese chess); fig. to protect a senior figure by blaming an underling; to pass the buck
